body_html:
edit_distance does not have a gradient, because it has integer outputs and outputs and is not differentiable. only ctc_loss is differentiable.
…
On Fri, Jan 19, 2018 at 2:53 PM, George Sterpu ***@***.***> wrote: Hi @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> , Excuse me for this rookie question. How do I find the gradient implementation of tf.edit_distance (or any other op) ? I added the tensor returned by tf.edit_distance to the traditional cross entropy loss, and can see that it is possible to pass this to an optimiser. The aim is to obtain an implementation that is conformant with Google's paper https://arxiv.org/abs/1712.01818 Thank you — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body_text:
edit_distance does not have a gradient, because it has integer outputs and
outputs and is not differentiable.  only ctc_loss is differentiable.
…
On Fri, Jan 19, 2018 at 2:53 PM, George Sterpu ***@***.***> wrote:
 Hi @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> ,
 Excuse me for this rookie question.
 How do I find the gradient implementation of tf.edit_distance (or any
 other op) ?

 I added the tensor returned by tf.edit_distance to the traditional cross
 entropy loss, and can see that it is possible to pass this to an optimiser.
 The aim is to obtain an implementation that is conformant with Google's
 paper https://arxiv.org/abs/1712.01818

 Thank you

body:
edit_distance does not have a gradient, because it has integer outputs and
outputs and is not differentiable.  only ctc_loss is differentiable.
